intro: Passiflora jorullensis var. jorullensis, commonly known as the Jorullén passionflower, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that feature five sepals, five petals, and a crown of filaments surrounding the reproductive structures. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces edible, orange-colored berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. The botanical features of this plant make it a subject of interest for both horticulturists and botanists.
